content:
Ladies and gentlemen, the response given by my colleague is undeniably engaging. It successfully diverts the conversation from a serious and scientific topic to something humorous and lighthearted. This is a crucial skill in any conversation, as it helps to keep the flow going and prevents boredom from setting in.

Furthermore, the response is unexpected and surprising, which is another key element of engaging conversation. By bringing up the fact that new Google employees are called "nooglers" and are given a propeller beanie cap to wear on their first Friday, it catches the attention of the listener and encourages them to participate in the discussion.

While it may not be directly related to the previous topic, the response is still relevant in its own way. It shows that the speaker has a broad range of knowledge and is capable of making connections between seemingly unrelated subjects. This can lead to a more dynamic and interesting conversation.

In conclusion, the response given by my colleague is highly engaging due to its humor, surprise factor, and relevance. It successfully adds a new dimension to the conversation and keeps the listener interested and involved.

: I must respectfully disagree with my colleague. While the response may be unexpected and surprising, it does not contribute anything substantial to the conversation. In fact, it completely derails the flow of the discussion and distracts from the original topic.

Furthermore, the response is not relevant to the current conversation at all. The fact that new Google employees are called "nooglers" has no connection to the discussion about science and astronomy. This lack of relevance can actually be off-putting to the listener, as it seems like the speaker is more interested in showing off their knowledge than actually engaging in meaningful discussion.

Finally, the response is not particularly humorous or lighthearted either. It feels forced and awkward, and it does not elicit any genuine laughter or amusement from the listener. This can actually have the opposite effect of engaging the listener, as it may make them feel uncomfortable or disinterested in continuing the conversation.

In conclusion, the response given by my colleague is not engaging due to its lack of relevance, forced humor, and overall disruption of the flow of the conversation. It does not add anything of value to the discussion and may even detract from the listener's interest in participating further.

The affirmative participant argues that the response is engaging because it adds humor and surprise to the conversation and demonstrates the speaker's ability to connect seemingly unrelated topics. They also suggest that the response is relevant in its own way and contributes to a more dynamic conversation. 

On the other hand, the negative participant argues that the response is not engaging because it lacks relevance, forced humor, and disrupts the flow of the conversation.

Based on the arguments presented, the affirmative participant wins the debate as they effectively demonstrate how the response is engaging through its humor, surprise, and relevance. The negative participant's argument that the response is not engaging due to a lack of relevance and awkward humor is not enough to counter the affirmative's points.

topic_chat_history:
did you see crazy rich asians ? 
 no i have n't . i heard it was good . 
 i have not yet either but i am aware of it 's cultural impact . it was made from a novel . apparently it is a very good romantic comedy . 
 my mother like it . i think it stars michelle yeoh , henry golding and constance wu , right ? 
 it does . apparently the basic premise is that a woman is engaged to a man and when she goes to meet his family discovers that he is insanely wealthy . his mother rejects her due to her less affluent background . 
 if i remember correctly , jon m chu is the director . 
 yes he is . it was also the first movie to feature an all - asian cast in hollywood in more than 20 years which is quite the accomplishment and i 'm glad that it did well . asians seem very underrepresented in film . 
 the movie is 121 minutes long , which is just right and is pg-13 . 
 that makes it accessible to a bigger audience which is good because then more asian - americans can see themselves represented on screen . 
 well , lets switch topics . are you a science person . , earth is the 3rd planet from the sun . it is also the only astronomical object known to harbor life . 
 i am a little . i enjoy learning about it . i was aware of those facts . i also know that if we viewed the entire earth 's history as a 24 hour period , humans would only represent 1 minute and 17 seconds of that day . that is a mind blowing stat . 
 this is mind blowing . thank god for jupiter . it saves earth from a lot of asteroids heading toward us . 
 that is really surprising since that planet is mostly compromised of gas . we do not even know if there is any solid land there . i wonder how it takes the impact first in this case ? 
 it 's very interesting . so is the fact that the sun is 4x less dense than earth . 
 i know it is much larger but i do n't think it has any solidity to it so that 's interesting . another science fact is that when earth was formed a day was only 5.5 hours long . 
 i did n't know that . i wonder why . there is a place on earth where there is less gravity than the rest of the planet . it is the hudson bay region of canada . 
 i wonder how much affect that has ? is it enough to change weights in any way ? i wonder . i do also know that we are running out of helium and will essentially be out of the gas by the end of the 21st century .
topic_chat_fact: new google employees are called ' nooglers ' and are given a propeller beanie cap to wear on their first friday .
topic_chat_response: yeah , and what 's funny is that new employees employees are called " nooglers " on their basketball field .
